snippet: Richard Strauss, born in Munich 150 years ago, gained fame with scandalous works before taking his experimentalism into the mainstream.
abstract: Richard Strauss, born in Munich 150 years ago, gained fame with scandalous works like his opera Salome but was later viewed by critics as casting off modernism in order to write beguiling operas about everyday life, scores that were awash in sumptuous lyricism and bittersweet evocations of bygone eras.
lead_paragraph: Richard Strauss, born in Munich 150 years ago, gained fame with scandalous works before taking his experimentalism into the mainstream.

headline.seo: A Look at Richard Strauss’s Legacy After 150 Years
headline.main: Drifting Back to the Real World
headline.print_headline: Drifting Back to the Real World
